issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When deleting a load balancer there are NoSuchElementException thrown in the log. The load balancer is still deleted.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.747.20140326git7c137674.el6

To reproduce:
# create a load balancer
# after the servo VM is running delete load balancer

{code}
2014-03-26 11:10:21 DEBUG 000000626 DatabaseAuthProvider     | Failed to find role by ID AROTSRXCXAUIVW0IQUM4J with exception java.util.NoSuchElementException: No com.eucalyptus.auth.entities.RoleEntity with roleId=AROTSRXCXAUIVW0IQUM4J | com.eucalyptus.auth.DatabaseAuthUtils.getUnique(DatabaseAuthUtils.java:409) | com.eucalyptus.auth.DatabaseAuthProvider.lookupRoleById(DatabaseAuthProvider.java:390) | com.eucalyptus.auth.Accounts.lookupRoleById(Accounts.java:237) | com.eucalyptus.auth.tokens.SecurityTokenManager.lookupRoleById(SecurityTokenManager.java:361) | com.eucalyptus.auth.tokens.SecurityTokenManager.doLookupAccessKey(SecurityTokenManager.java:284) | com.eucalyptus.auth.tokens.SecurityTokenManager.lookupAccessKey(SecurityTokenManager.java:144) | com.eucalyptus.auth.AccessKeys.lookupAccessKey(AccessKeys.java:46) | com.eucalyptus.auth.login.HmacLoginModuleSupport.lookupAccessKey(HmacLoginModuleSupport.java:126) | com.eucalyptus.auth.login.Hmacv2LoginModule.authenticate(Hmacv2LoginModule.java:92) | com.eucalyptus.auth.login.Hmacv2LoginModule.authenticate(Hmacv2LoginModule.java:81) | com.eucalyptus.auth.api.BaseLoginModule.login(BaseLoginModule.java:159) | com.eucalyptus.ws.handlers.HmacHandler.incomingMessage(HmacHandler.java:127) | com.eucalyptus.ws.handlers.MessageStackHandler.incomingMessage(MessageStackHandler.java:105) | com.eucalyptus.ws.handlers.MessageStackHandler.handleUpstream(MessageStackHandler.java:114) | com.eucalyptus.ws.server.NioServerHandler.messageReceived(NioServerHandler.java:132) | com.eucalyptus.ws.Handlers$BootstrapStateCheck.handleUpstream(Handlers.java:227) | com.eucalyptus.ws.Handlers$NioSslHandler.handleUpstream(Handlers.java:346) |

fields.summary: No Such Role exception when deleting load balancers

comments.body: This is due to the role that is related to a security token being deleted. Generally this seems like reasonable output for debug level, though the stack traces could probably be removed (we'd need to be careful not to loose useful logging for the BaseLoginModule though)
